results.title: Water project
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Describes methods for irrigation of lands which receive an irregular rainfall. At the Sydney University Animal Husbandry Farm experiments were carried out on dry pastures and it was found that irrigation dams, supplied by run-off from the farm, made available a plentiful year-round supply of water. Portable sprinkler systems were used to distribute the dam water. Another irrigation system is the Keyline System, the main feature of which is the off-contour ribbing of land so that water is collected where it falls and used when required. Dams along the ribs provide storage for excess water.

results.title: Water power
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: A study of the development of the use of water power in the USA, from the small watermill of the early settler to the immense hydro-electricity projects at Niagara, Boulder Dam, and the Tennessee Valley today. A survey of the potential water-power of the world completes the film.

results.title: Water polo: training practices
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the basic skills of water polo can best be practised. The practices are grouped as 1. ball handling practices, 2. films training practices, and 3. tactical practices. Great Britain Water Polo Squad demonstrates the skill. Suitable for players, teachers and coaches.

results.title: Water polo: skills
results.brief_description: Illustrates all the basic skills of water polo. Shows 1. the necessary swimming skills, 2. ball handling skills, and 3. marking, tackling and goalkeeping skills. Uses close-up and underwater shots of individual players.

results.title: Water polo: Montreal Olympics
results.creator_credit: Barry Williams, Dennis A. Hill and Dennis Hill Productions
results.brief_description: Includes excerpts from final rounds of water polo played between West Germany and Rumania, Hungary and Yugoslavia, Hungary and Italy, Italy and Holland during the Montreal Olympics held in 1976. Also includes a visual demonstration of training methods and rules and techniques as explained by the Dutch coach.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Williams, Dennis A. Hill and Dennis Hill Productions

results.title: Water polo
results.brief_description: A detailed examination of isolated movements in water polo, including lifting, catching, and returning the ball, leg action during a throw, and various forms of tackle. The distribution of players in the pool, and various methods of positioning and attacking and defending are shown both by direct photography and the use of animation. Players include Dr Sutton, the English captain, Martin, North, and Pascoe, international players, and members of the Plaistow and Oxford and Cambridge Universities Water Polo teams.

results.title: Water pollution: a first film
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Norman Bean Films
results.brief_description: Follows a single stream from its origin to its end in order to reveal the many different sources of pollution. Points out that individuals as well as groups can help clean up water resources.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BFA Educational Media and Norman Bean Films

results.title: Water is the key
results.creator_credit: Rodney Musch, Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the many uses to which water, Tasmania’s greatest natural resource, is put, including generation of hydro-electric power, irrigation, and industrial and domestic consumption.
